name.en: Photogrammetry, UAV data acquisition, processing, and analyses
name.ch: 攝影測量、無人機資料收集處理與分析

goal.en: This course introduces principles for the remote sensing methodology based on UAVs (drones) that are applied for the earth scientific surveys. The main scope of the course is to be able to obtain 3D surface/topography models for any further scientific fields and aspects as: geomorphology, structural geology, hydrology, hydrogeology, vulcanology, etc., for surveys as: coastal erosion, landscape reorganization, environment changes, river system evolution, glaciers retreat, lands subsidence, natural hazards as landslides and earthquakes, and many others. On the basis of the lecture, students are expected to understand and be able to manually acquire aerial images using drones (UAV) then process them and generate images to build 3D maps as DSM (digital surface models). Also, the course prepares students to be able to pilot a drone themselves with a deeper knowledge of safety, laws, rules hardware, and such. This part of the course is based on the official syllabus for the UAV license course UAVO (inmanned aerial vehicle operator) approved by the ICAO (International Civil Aviation Organization).

content.en:
1. Introduction to Remote Sensing and general approach to the course.
2. Hardware and platforms used in the Remote Sensing surveys.
3. Remote Sensing Research in Earth Sciences.
4. UAV safety, preparation, and terminology, rules and laws.
5. UAV hardware and maintaining.
6. Introduction to orthophotographic and photogrammetric processing as well as Structure-from-Motion (SfM).
7. RTK, PPK, GCP and image processing.
8. Piloting UAV (1)- initial, procedures, securing the LZ (landing zone), launching, landing, etc.
9. Piloting UAV (2)- figures and operating the drone in the airspace.
10. Piloting UAV (3)- image acquisition for further processing.
11. Software introduction and image processing.
12. Structure-from-Motion (SfM) principles and application in earth science surveys.
13. Fieldtrip (1) and image acquisition by UAV.
14. Fieldtrip (2) and image acquisition by UAV.
15. Image processing for SfM using Metashape software (1).
16. Image processing for SfM using Metashape software (2).
